artefact.overview: To practise as a solicitor in Scotland, you must be admitted as a solicitor, have your name on the roll and hold a practising certificate
artefact.licence_short_description: To practise as a solicitor in Scotland, you must be admitted as a solicitor, have your name on the roll and hold a practising certificate.
artefact.licence_overview:
To practise as a solicitor in Scotland, you must be admitted as a solicitor, have your name on the roll and hold a practising certificate.

Practising certificates are obtained from the [Council of the Law Society of Scotland.](http://www.lawscot.org.uk/ "Council of the Law Society of Scotland"){:rel="external"}

You must pay a fee to obtain a practising certificate.

Conditions may be attached to a practicing certificate under certain circumstances.
